pages.raw_output:
<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 186, 171, 201]]<|/det|>
# PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 206, 366, 222]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Multiple Choice (Extended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[90, 247, 590, 291]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Multiple Choice Answer Sheet Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 312, 388, 328]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 342, 237, 357]]<|/det|>
Write in soft pencil.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 357, 504, 372]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 372, 892, 401]]<|/det|>
Write your name, Centre number and candidate number on the Answer Sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 400, 383, 415]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 429, 892, 459]]<|/det|>
There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions. For each question there are four possible answers A, B, C and D.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 459, 890, 475]]<|/det|>
Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the separate Answer Sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 488, 556, 504]]<|/det|>
Read the instructions on the Answer Sheet very carefully.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 517, 764, 533]]<|/det|>
Each correct answer will score one mark. A mark will not be deducted for a wrong answer.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 533, 467, 548]]<|/det|>
Any rough working should be done in this booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 549, 359, 564]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators may be used.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 564, 630, 579]]<|/det|>
Take the weight of \(1.0\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 71, 616, 89]]<|/det|>
A student investigates the rate of flow of oil through a funnel.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 101, 922, 135]]<|/det|>
The diagrams show the experiment and the volume of oil in the measuring cylinder at the start of the experiment, and one minute later.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[262, 144, 737, 393]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 405, 702, 424]]<|/det|>
What is the rate of flow of oil through the funnel during the one minute?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 432, 133, 451]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 432, 740, 451]]<|/det|>
0.73 cm³/s B 0.80 cm³/s C 44 cm³/s D 48 cm³/s

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 477, 96, 496]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 477, 816, 496]]<|/det|>
Four balls with different masses are dropped simultaneously from the heights shown.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 508, 369, 526]]<|/det|>
Air resistance may be ignored.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 539, 356, 556]]<|/det|>
Which ball hits the floor last?

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[168, 565, 826, 775]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
The gravitational field strength on the Earth is greater than the gravitational field strength on the Moon. The Earth has an atmosphere, but the Moon does not.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 117, 920, 150]]<|/det|>
Which speed-time graph represents the motion of a light ball dropped from a great height near the surface of the Earth and near the surface of the Moon?

<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 72, 845, 91]]<|/det|>
A body of mass \(m\) has a weight \(W\) in a location where the gravitational field strength is \(g\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 102, 536, 120]]<|/det|>
Which statement about these quantities is correct?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 131, 134, 147]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 131, 363, 147]]<|/det|>
$m$ and $W$ are both forces.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 157, 133, 175]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 156, 448, 175]]<|/det|>
$m$ and $W$ are both vector quantities.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 180, 131, 199]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 180, 520, 199]]<|/det|>
$m$ and \(W\) are related by the equation \(\frac{W}{m} = g\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 205, 133, 223]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 205, 395, 223]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 252, 97, 269]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 250, 920, 285]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 498, 556, 516]]<|/det|>
